title: American Airlines flight makes emergency landing after passenger urinated, exposed himself
content: ​An American Airlines flight made an emergency landing in New York Wednesday after Neil McCarthy, a 25-year-old Oregon man, urinated in the aisle of the airplane and then exposed himself. The man was arrested and charged with indecent exposure and was later released after he appeared in a Buffalo federal court, New York Post reported.
summary: ​An American Airlines flight made an emergency landing in New York Wednesday after Neil McCarthy, a 25-year-old Oregon man, urinated in the aisle of the airplane and then exposed himself. The man was arrested and charged with indecent exposure and was later released after he appeared in a Buffalo federal court, New York Post reported.

title: 'Barron seems uncomfortable': Social media slams Donald Trump for leaked video
content: A video of Donald Trump dishing out some unpalatable comments about Joe Biden and Kamala Harris as he was probably chilling at a golf course got leaked Thursday making no one squirm for he's known for such comments. But social media users absolutely abhorred the fact that Trump did not even think twice about his 18-year-old son Barron Trump sitting next to him.
summary: A video of Donald Trump dishing out some unpalatable comments about Joe Biden and Kamala Harris as he was probably chilling at a golf course got leaked Thursday making no one squirm for he's known for such comments. But social media users absolutely abhorred the fact that Trump did not even think twice about his 18-year-old son Barron Trump sitting next to him.

title: 'What the hell is happening': Why Hunter Biden keeping close watch on father
content: President Joe Biden's son Hunter Biden has been keeping a close watch on his father now following the debate disaster. The White House has clarified that Joe Biden is not opting out of the race but according to reports the entry of Hunter Biden, convicted of felony gun charges, into the official circle of the President has made White House staff members asking each other, "What the hell is happening?".
summary: President Joe Biden's son Hunter Biden has been keeping a close watch on his father now following the debate disaster. The White House has clarified that Joe Biden is not opting out of the race but according to reports the entry of Hunter Biden, convicted of felony gun charges, into the official circle of the President has made White House staff members asking each other, "What the hell is happening?".

title: Hurricane Beryl heads for Cayman Islands, Mexico after striking Jamaica
content: Hurricane Beryl targets Cayman Islands and Mexico after hitting Jamaica with severe winds and rain. Beryl, now Category 3, caused 10 deaths. PM Andrew Holness issued curfew. Grand Cayman faces life-threatening conditions. St. Vincent, Union Island, and Grenada were severely hit. Earlier Category 5. Amoy Wellington, NOAA, PM Ralph Gonsalves, and Richard Thompson confirm devastation.
summary: Hurricane Beryl targets Cayman Islands and Mexico after hitting Jamaica with severe winds and rain. Beryl, now Category 3, caused 10 deaths. PM Andrew Holness issued curfew. Grand Cayman faces life-threatening conditions. St. Vincent, Union Island, and Grenada were severely hit. Earlier Category 5. Amoy Wellington, NOAA, PM Ralph Gonsalves, and Richard Thompson confirm devastation.

title: The suspect in the attempted assassination of Slovakia's prime minister now faces terror charges
content: Slovakia's Prosecutor-General has charged the suspect in the May 15 assassination attempt on Prime Minister Robert Fico with terrorism. Initially charged with attempted murder, the suspect, identified as JC, allegedly acted with third-party support. Fico, a divisive figure known for his pro-Russia stance, is recovering from multiple wounds. The incident has sparked nationwide protests.
summary: Slovakia's Prosecutor-General has charged the suspect in the May 15 assassination attempt on Prime Minister Robert Fico with terrorism. Initially charged with attempted murder, the suspect, identified as JC, allegedly acted with third-party support. Fico, a divisive figure known for his pro-Russia stance, is recovering from multiple wounds. The incident has sparked nationwide protests.

DR Congo soldiers sentenced to death for fleeing battle
content: In North Kivu, Democratic Republic of Congo, 25 soldiers were sentenced to death for fleeing Rwanda-backed M23 rebels and theft. They deserted positions, stole goods, and were detained with wives. One got a 10-year sentence. Lawyer Jules Muvweko will appeal. Army spokesman Reagan Mbuyi Kalonji noted internal military divisions. Eight officers were sentenced to death in May.
summary: In North Kivu, Democratic Republic of Congo, 25 soldiers were sentenced to death for fleeing Rwanda-backed M23 rebels and theft. They deserted positions, stole goods, and were detained with wives. One got a 10-year sentence. Lawyer Jules Muvweko will appeal. Army spokesman Reagan Mbuyi Kalonji noted internal military divisions. Eight officers were sentenced to death in May.

Remains of missing 12-year-old child found after suspected crocodile attack
content: Australian police found remains of a 12-year-old attacked by a crocodile at Mango Creek, Palumpa during a holiday visit. Senior Sergeant Erica Gibson expressed sorrow. A black crocodile was seen. NT has over 100,000 crocodiles. A 2013 incident involved a 4.5-meter crocodile; in 2017, one man survived a non-fatal attack. Recently, a menacing crocodile was shot, cooked, and eaten.
summary: Australian police found remains of a 12-year-old attacked by a crocodile at Mango Creek, Palumpa during a holiday visit. Senior Sergeant Erica Gibson expressed sorrow. A black crocodile was seen. NT has over 100,000 crocodiles. A 2013 incident involved a 4.5-meter crocodile; in 2017, one man survived a non-fatal attack. Recently, a menacing crocodile was shot, cooked, and eaten.

title: Two-finger test: Doctor in Pakistan fired for performing banned virginity test on rape victim
content: In 2020, the LHC prohibited the use of the two-finger virginity test in rape examinations, deeming it "humiliating having no forensic value".​
summary: In 2020, the LHC prohibited the use of the two-finger virginity test in rape examinations, deeming it "humiliating having no forensic value".​

title: China warns of hotter, longer heatwaves as climate change intensifies
content: China's climate is rapidly changing, leading to hotter summers, heavier rains, and record temperatures. The China Meteorological Administration warns of significant temperature increases and more unpredictable weather patterns. The country faces challenges adapting to these changes, with potential for more extreme heat events and increased rainfall in the future.
summary: China's climate is rapidly changing, leading to hotter summers, heavier rains, and record temperatures. The China Meteorological Administration warns of significant temperature increases and more unpredictable weather patterns. The country faces challenges adapting to these changes, with potential for more extreme heat events and increased rainfall in the future.

title: California man guilty of stabbing gay student in 2018
content: Samuel Woodward, 26, was convicted of first-degree murder with a hate crime enhancement for the killing of University of Pennsylvania student Blaze Bernstein. The prosecution presented evidence linking Woodward to the crime, including his affiliation with a violent, anti-gay extremist group. The defense plans to appeal the ruling.
summary: Samuel Woodward, 26, was convicted of first-degree murder with a hate crime enhancement for the killing of University of Pennsylvania student Blaze Bernstein. The prosecution presented evidence linking Woodward to the crime, including his affiliation with a violent, anti-gay extremist group. The defense plans to appeal the ruling.

title: Donald Trump keeps low profile while Joe Biden faces furor over candidacy
content: Former President Donald Trump has strategically minimized his public appearances following President Joe Biden's poor debate performance, allowing Democratic struggles to dominate the news cycle. By avoiding the spotlight and canceling planned events, Trump has allowed political pressure to mount on Biden, which has resulted in polls showing an increased lead for Trump both nationally and in swing states.
summary: Former President Donald Trump has strategically minimized his public appearances following President Joe Biden's poor debate performance, allowing Democratic struggles to dominate the news cycle. By avoiding the spotlight and canceling planned events, Trump has allowed political pressure to mount on Biden, which has resulted in polls showing an increased lead for Trump both nationally and in swing states.

title: Grubbs fire: Northern California battles multiple wildfires, 26,000 evacuated
content: Evacuation orders for the Grubbs Fire in Palermo have been downgraded to warnings, impacting several zones in Butte County. The fire, igniting off Grubbs Road and Brollier Way, is part of a series of wildfires in Northern California, forcing 26,000 people to evacuate. The Thompson Fire near Oroville has grown significantly, while new fires have emerged, prompting further evacuations. A state of emergency has been declared, with federal funding approved to support firefighting efforts amid extreme heat and fire risk.
summary: Evacuation orders for the Grubbs Fire in Palermo have been downgraded to warnings, impacting several zones in Butte County. The fire, igniting off Grubbs Road and Brollier Way, is part of a series of wildfires in Northern California, forcing 26,000 people to evacuate. The Thompson Fire near Oroville has grown significantly, while new fires have emerged, prompting further evacuations. A state of emergency has been declared, with federal funding approved to support firefighting efforts amid extreme heat and fire risk.

title: 'We are all looking for path to win': Over 20 governors come to Biden's rescue amid calls for stepping down
content: White House Press Secretary Jean-Pierre affirms Biden's dedication to the campaign amid doubts from Democrats about his strategy.

title: Man jailed for carrying 6-inch replica of iconic sword from Nintendo
content: A man in Nuneaton, Warwickshire, Anthony Bray, was sentenced to four months in prison for carrying a 6-inch Master Sword replica from Nintendo's The Legend of Zelda series. Despite claiming it was a fidget toy, he was arrested for carrying a bladed article. Bray received a four-month prison sentence and a victims' surcharge of £154.
summary: A man in Nuneaton, Warwickshire, Anthony Bray, was sentenced to four months in prison for carrying a 6-inch Master Sword replica from Nintendo's The Legend of Zelda series. Despite claiming it was a fidget toy, he was arrested for carrying a bladed article. Bray received a four-month prison sentence and a victims' surcharge of £154.
